segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, cascading down the cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman, standing in the puddle, seemingly unfazed by the water around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be deep in thought or perhaps daydreaming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children, their eyes fixed on the cookie jar, oblivious to the water creeping closer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of dread as I watch the stool wobble under the boy's weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl, her hand outstretched, waiting for her share of the loot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they make a good team, those two, even if their methods are a bit risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, a picture of tranquility compared to the kitchen's impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like a painting, so still and perfect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman snaps out of her daze and the children get their cookies safely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what will happen next, if the stool will tip or the woman will slip.
segments.speaker: PAR
